snippet: Right-wing commentators blamed Gov. Chris Christie’s praise of President Obama’s role in Hurricane Sandy recovery efforts for Mitt Romney’s defeat.
abstract: New Jersey Gov Chris Christie draws both scorn from Republicans for his praise of Pres Barack Obama's response to Hurricane Sandy, and praise from Democrats and others who appreciate his results-oriented, bipartisan style; Christie's handling of storm has burnished his reputation locally and nationally and may position him well for second term as governor or run at the White House.
lead_paragraph: Right-wing commentators blamed Gov. Chris Christie’s praise of President Obama’s role in Hurricane Sandy recovery efforts for Mitt Romney’s defeat.

headline.seo: Hurricane Response Burnishes Gov. Christie’s Reputation
headline.main: With Storm Response, Christie Earns Scorn, Praise and Much Attention
headline.print_headline: With Storm Response, Christie Earns Scorn, Praise and Lots of Attention
